content: quote: TUESDAY, April 14 (HealthDay News) -- A particular type of stem cell transplantation using the patient's own cells led to short-term freedom from insulin injections in 20 of 23 patients newly diagnosed with type 1 diabetes participating in an experimental protocol in Brazil. One patient even managed to go four years without needing outside sources of insulin, although the average was 31 months, said the authors of a report in the April 15 issue of the Journal of the American Medical Association, a themed issue on diabetes. The patients also kept their blood sugar under control, which is key to preventing complications from diabetes. And, the authors stated, increased C-peptide levels indicated that the pancreas' beta cells were alive and well. Kudos, but there is still a long road ahead! +http://www.forbes.com/feeds/hscout/2009/04/14/hscout626051.html "None are more hopelessly enslaved than those who falsely believe they are free." -Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

content: quote: Originally posted by NSNN: quote: TUESDAY, April 14 (HealthDay News) -- A particular type of stem cell transplantation using the patient's own cells led to short-term freedom from insulin injections in 20 of 23 patients newly diagnosed with type 1 diabetes participating in an experimental protocol in Brazil. One patient even managed to go four years without needing outside sources of insulin, although the average was 31 months, said the authors of a report in the April 15 issue of the Journal of the American Medical Association, a themed issue on diabetes. The patients also kept their blood sugar under control, which is key to preventing complications from diabetes. And, the authors stated, increased C-peptide levels indicated that the pancreas' beta cells were alive and well. Kudos, but there is still a long road ahead! +http://www.forbes.com/feeds/hscout/2009/04/14/hscout626051.html The Stem Cell research most people were against were FETAL stem cell, not adult stem cells. Adult stem cells have proven more viable then one from a dead baby. Todays politics remind me of an old saying. - "Ideas are more powerful than guns. We would not let our enemies have guns, why should we let them have ideas?" - Joseph Stalin

content: ADULT Stem cells have produced desireable results. Fetal Stem Cells have peroduced tumors. Is there a message here from somewhere?

content: On a positive note, insulin can provide permanent freedom from stem cells.
